definition: disturbing the privacy of bridal room (Chinese custom where guests banter with and play pranks on the newlyweds)
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Inside, Harvey's friends played many jokes on them. Kent thought it was a lot of fun.
sentences.chinese: 哈維的朋友們在裏面鬧洞房，肯特覺得很好玩兒。

sentences.english: Later in Britain, the "bawdy" custom of flinging the stocking became popular.
sentences.chinese: 後來英國人“鬧洞房”“拋長襪”的習俗變得起來。

sentences.english: Later in Britain, the "bawdy" custom of flinging the stocking" became popular.
sentences.chinese: 後來英國人“鬧洞房”“拋長襪”的習俗變得起來。

sentences.english: Night, still have some friends make chamber.
sentences.chinese: 晚上，還有些朋友鬧鬧洞房。
